title: New poll shows more Americans 'strongly disapprove' of Trump's second term
shortDescription: In a poll from YouGov/The Economist, two-thirds say they have strong feelings about Donald Trump - either positive or negative. Here's the breakdown.

title: Trump sends warm letter to Zelenskyy as he presses for Putin meeting
shortDescription: 'The United States supports a negotiated settlement' with Russia, President Donald Trump added in a warm letter to the Ukrainian leader.

title: Frustrated voters caught in redistricting war: 'This is strictly politics'
shortDescription: As Texas approves new congressional maps, California is fighting back. Caught in the middle are frustrated voters.

title: Texas Senate approves redistricting bill
shortDescription: The Texas Senate approved the GOP-favored voting map that could flip five seats in the 2026 midterm elections.

title: Trump admin. wants to send Kilmar Abrego Garcia to Uganda: Filings
shortDescription: His lawyers say he's being coerced into pleading guilty in a criminal case in order to not be sent to the African country.

title: Can Trump and the GOP beat the midterm odds - and history - in 2026?
shortDescription: Trump is pushing the envelope of typical campaign maneuvering with things like redistricting, and the party is jumping at his orders.

title: He won over Charlamagne tha God. Now Gavin Newsom is coming for Trump
shortDescription: California's governor is raking in cash and skyrocketing to the top of the polls for his eye-for-an-eye approach as he imitates Trump's online rants.

title: Trump announces a 10% US stake in struggling chipmaker Intel
shortDescription: Intel is expected to receive about $10 billion in CHIPS Act grants from the government to help fund the building of chip plants in the U.S.

title: Trump admin fires head of Defense Intelligence agency, senator says
shortDescription: The ouster of Lt. Gen. Jeffrey Kruse is latest in series of moves to purge the US intelligence community and install Trump loyalists in top positions.

title: Trump says Putin 'may' attend FIFA
shortDescription: President Donald Trump suggested Vladimir Putin "may" come to the 2026 FIFA World Cup, despite Russia being banned after the 2022 Ukraine invasion.

title: Trump plans to target Chicago next
shortDescription: After deploying troops to DC, President Donald Trump says Chicago is next—even as crime there is already down.

title: Trump admin pauses foreign truck driver visas after deadly crash
shortDescription: The move is the latest in a series by the White House to clamp down on foreign truckers.

title: Trump on Epstein file release: 'Innocent people shouldn't be hurt.'
shortDescription: "Innocent people shouldn’t be hurt but I’m in support of keeping it totally open, I couldn’t care less," Trump said during a White House event Aug 22.

title: Trump says Vladimir Putin 'may' attend 2026 World Cup
shortDescription: Despite Russia being banned from FIFA competitions, Trump said he thinks Putin will attend the 2026 World Cup.

title: Trump: 'I look extremely good in shorts'
shortDescription: The president joked about participating in the FIFA World Cup draw when it comes to the Kennedy Center in December.

title: Chicago is 'next' for federal takeover of police force, says Trump
shortDescription: Trump has already deployed 800 National Guard troops in Washington DC, declaring a public safety emergency. He is setting his sights now on Chicago.
